KCNA Blasts Japanese LDP Heavyweight's Anti-DPRK Remarks in U.S.
articles.content:
Pilgrimage Movement for Defence of Tok Islet in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Members of the Headquarters of the People's Movement for Society entered a pilgrimage movement for the defence of Tok Islet in connection with the fact that a right-wing organization of Japan attempted to land in the islet, according to the south Korean KBS.
 They in a statement on May 5 said that they could not repress surging indignation at the Japanese right-wing organization's attempt to land in Tok Islet, calling for clearly showing to the world through a resolute action that the islet is part of the Korean territory.    
 They conducted the pilgrimage activities in defence of Tok Islet from Jumunjin of Kangrung, south Korean Kangwon Province, through Sokcho and Samchok, Uljin and Phohang, North Kyongsang Province, and up to Pusan.

articles.content:
Chairperson of Hyundai Group and Her Party Here
    Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Hyon Jong Un, chairperson of the Hyundai Group of south Korea, and her party arrived here Tuesday.
 Kim Yun Gyu, president of Hyundai Asan, was included in her party.    
 They were warmly greeted at the airport by Ri Jong Hyok, vice-chairman of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, and other officials concerned with compatriotic feelings.

articles.title: All Koreans Render Assistance to Ryongchon
articles.content:
Polish Embassy Officials Visit Revolutionary Site on Mt. Ryongak
    Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Polish Ambassador to the DPRK Wojciech Kaluza and embassy officials visited the Revolutionary Site on Mt. Ryongak Tuesday on the occasion of the Constitutional Day of Poland.
 Being briefed on the fact that the revolutionary site associated with the immortal footprints of the three generals of Mt. Paektu has been built into a leisure time resort for the people, the guests looked round the revolutionary mementoes and historic relics with keen interest.
